bio:
I am a Computer Engineer who has studied mainly in Spain, and I have also studied in the United States and Austria through university exchange programs.

I started my professional career in Spain as a Linux system administrator. After moving to Amsterdam in The Netherlands, I have continued my professional career working on infrastructure and operations issues with Linux clusters in different projects. I also worked with Openstack to virtualize the clusters of the company where I was working at the time. Later the company adopted Kubernetes, and I was able to take my first steps in containers.

Since 2018 I have worked on different projects with Azure and Kubernetes, both as an employee of a consulting firm, and as a freelancer.

Finally, since the end of the Covid pandemic, I've been attending meetups and conferences (in person and virtual) more often to meet more people with my same interests.

She is a regular speaker at software conferences, including KubeCon, CodeOne, JavaOne, Devoxx, JFokus, and others. She was awarded an Oracle Groundbreaker Ambassador title in 2020 and 2021, Oracle ACE Associate and Pro in 2022 and 2023. She was also named as one of Top 10 Women in Tech in Poland in 2016.

Her interests focus on automated software engineering, mainly static and dynamic analysis techniques to support software verification, optimization, and deployment.

bio:
Piotr is a seasoned Cloud Native Devops and Platform Automation mentor with profound insights on original product development ranging across multiple diverse markets. Contributions he made are still alive in sectors of industry 4.0, banking, logistics, fuel, gambling and even air defense systems.

Piotr is aiming to make a positive impact on any business and person they engage with by using his passion for simplifying complex systems, sharing knowledge and leaving things in better shape than he approached it. What truly sets him apart is an extensive Personal Knowledge Garden, a Hawaiian shirts collection and a wide range of hobbies (running TTRPG, probability driven optimization for board games, playing harmonica, rapid-prototyping and manufacturing, vector and traditional graphics, motorcycle joyrides),

His career has encompassed various roles: from a robotics constructor, graphics designer, analyst and events organizer. He is also well-versed in community efforts and developer's relations. His commitment to enhancing collaboration and fostering a strong community created a testament that makes many peers he worked with still consider him a go-to for technical dilemmas, help with overthrowing the status quo and improving developer experiences.

bio:
With over 13 years of experience in the computer software industry, I am a seasoned Software Engineer adept at crafting Cloud Native applications and Web applications, primarily utilising Golang, .Net, and React (TypeScript). Throughout my professional journey, I have honed my skills in diverse programming languages such as C#, Golang, and JavaScript. My expertise extends to leveraging various tools and technologies, and I have gained exposure to multiple cloud solutions, including AWS, GCP, and DO.

I thrive on challenges and actively seek projects that push me beyond my comfort zone, allowing me to expand my knowledge and skill set. The continuous pursuit of learning new languages and development techniques is not only a personal passion but also a commitment to contributing to the success of the organisations I work with.

In 2021, I transitioned into the role of a DevOps Engineer to deepen my understanding of the Kubernetes Administration ecosystem. This experience has provided me with valuable insights into the intricacies of managing Kubernetes, reinforcing my expertise in orchestrating containerised applications. Currently, I am working as a Senior Golang Engineer, combining my extensive software engineering background with newfound insights from the DevOps domain to deliver robust and scalable solutions.

sessions.name: Kubernetes Operators: A Comprehensive Guide from Development to Deployment
Securing Kubernetes: Practical Workflows and Tools for Enhanced Cluster Protection

bio: Ram is a Senior Software Engineer at JFrog R&D . Previously worked for startup companies like  CallidusCloud (SAP Company), Konylabs. Loves Automation, Linux, openSource

sessions.name: Unlocking Developer productivity (DIY) - Best practices to release faster  !
Who broke the build? — Using Kuttl to improve E2E testing and release faster

bio: Hi, I'm Raúl! I've been exploring the world of cloud-native tech for over 5 years since my first dive into KubeCon Copenhagen back in 2018. I love tackling new challenges and finding creative solutions in the world of cloud native technologies. Right now, I'm leading a team at DE-CIX, working on a platform to make the transition to cloud-native smoother for other teams.

sessions.name: Kubernetes Policy-as-Code with Kyverno

bio: Reza Ramezanpour is a Developer Advocate at Tigera where he eagerly tries to demystify the less-known capabilities of open source. Throughout his professional career years in IT he has been a developer, system administrator, and reverse engineer.

sessions.name: How many engineers does it take to… run 1,000 Kubernetes clusters?

bio: Robert works as a Principal Specialist Solution Architect at Red Hat and a Subject Matter Expert for OpenShift Container Platform. With over 10 years of middleware operating experience from automation to monitoring and more than 5 years of container know-how, Robert primarily supports large German customers with their OpenShift adoption; starting with the introduction, 24x7 operations up to the migration and modernization of complex applications.
tagLine: Helps customer and partner with their Container Journey

sessions.name: What is an operator? How to use, build and ship it!

bio: Roberto is a Cloud Services Black Belt specializing in Container Orchestration Platforms (OpenShift & Kubernetes), Cloud, DevSecOps, and CICD.
tagLine: Red Hat - Cloud Services Black Belt

sessions.name: Building and deploying Open Source Generative AI Models in Kubernetes
GitOps Patterns for managing and scaling cloud native applications

bio: As a Google Developer Expert specializing in Google Cloud, I am a passionate DevOps Advocate and a dedicated Community Evangelist. I lead and nurture multiple communities across diverse platforms, fostering DevOps and Developer Relations awareness. My commitment to the open-source ecosystem is demonstrated through delivering presentations, crafting documentation and blogs, and contributing code. Presently, my focus is on innovating within the service mesh technology stack.

sessions.name: Enhanced Platform Engineering: A Guide to Infrastructure Modernization
The Kubernetes Kaleidoscope: My Colorful Path to CNCF Ambassadorship

bio: With nearly two decades of experience in software development and leadership I possess a strong skill set in coding, software architecture, design principles and Cloud technologies particularly using Azure. I am passionate about leading software development teams and providing technical guidance to deliver exceptional software products.
tagLine: I am always passionate to transform complex challenges into elegant software solutions.

sessions.name: Building a Serverless REST API With Azure Functions
Building Cloud-Native App with .NET Aspire

bio: Sara Qasmi is a Platform Engineer/SRE at German Edge Cloud, specializing in building secure and reliable Kubernetes platforms at the edge. With a diverse background in software engineering and DevOps, she actively contributes to the development of modern platforms.

sessions.name: Introducing the BACK stack!

bio:
Shedrack Akintayo is a Developer Relations Professional and Technical Writer with over 5+ years of experience in Technology and a track record in Web Engineering, Community Management, and Developer Relations on a global scale. He has given talks/workshops at developer conferences like DrupalCon North America, JS Nation Live, DevRel Asia, and All Things Open among many others.

He also supports DevRel Community Africa, Open-Source Community Africa, and other communities empowering Africa and the world with Technology.

sessions.name: Cloud Native: Your First Steps

bio:
Simon originally comes from the DevOps world and first came into contact with containers 6 years ago. Starting from traditional user perspective at large banks and small start-ups, Simon is now working on the provider side. Currently he is focused on making it easier to install Applications into Kubernetes clusters and improving the experience when using Kubernetes locally.
When not in front of a computer, Simon can be found running through nature or trying out new recipes in the kitchen.

sessions.name: Organizing Lots of Kubeconfigs Without Going Crazy
Papers, Please - Enforcing Security Standards via Validating Admission Policies

bio: Am Working in Microsoft Azure and AWS IaaS/PaaS service and Devops enginee. i has Microsoft Certified Trainer (MCT) of High Expertise with Azure IaaS, Linux, Git, GitHub, Bash Scripting, Azure ARM template, Amazon Web Services AWS fundamental, Microsoft Azure Certified AZ-104 and AZ-900, also AZ-500.
tagLine: CNCF @Ambassador, CNCF Lahore @Organizer, DevOps Engineer @Ascend solutions,

sessions.name: Opensource -  Build A Zero-Trust Access To Servers & Cloud Applications

bio: Thomas is Senior Developer Advocate at Sysdig, the company which created and open-sourced Falco, the Security Runtime Engine for Kubernetes and Cloud-Native technologies. Thomas worked for Qonto, a modern banking for SMEs and freelancers, where he managed their Kubernetes clusters and the enthusiastic tools around, like ArgoCD, Traefik, Prometheus. He also assisted for many years pure-players and e-business companies for a large managed service provider, as an AWS expert and FinOps. He's one of the longest tenured members of the Falco community, and creator of Falcosidekick and Falcosidekick-UI, two major components of the Falco ecosystem.

sessions.name: Closing the Loop: Applying Least Privilege and Ensuring We Did It Well

bio:
Thomas Vitale is a software engineer and architect specialized in building cloud native, resilient, and secure enterprise applications. He’s the author of “Cloud Native Spring in Action” published by Manning. Thomas designs and develops software solutions at Systematic, Denmark, where he’s been working on modernizing platforms and applications for the cloud native world, focusing on developer experience and security.

Some of his main interests and focus areas are Java, Spring Boot, Kubernetes, Knative, and cloud native technologies in general. Thomas supports continuous delivery practices and believes in a collaboration culture aimed at working together to deliver value to users, customers, and businesses. He likes contributing to open source projects in the Java and cloud native space, and sharing knowledge with the community.

Thomas has an MSc in Computer Engineering, specializing in software from the Polytechnic University of Turin (Italy). He is a CNCF Certified Kubernetes Application Developer, Red Hat Certified Specialist in OpenShift Application Development, and Pivotal Certified Spring Professional. His speaking engagements include those for KubeCon+CloudNativeCon, Devoxx, GOTO, SpringOne, Spring I/O, JBCNConf, DevTalks, and J4K.
tagLine: Software Architect - Author of "Cloud Native Spring in Action" - OSS Contributor

sessions.name: Unlocking New Platform Experiences With Open Interfaces

bio:
I'm Tiago, a Developer Advocate for PagerDuty and an open source contributor and maintainer.

Before joining PagerDuty, I led the cloud and platform engineering teams at MUSIC Tribe, working on cloud-connected instruments. My career has always been focused on supporting developers and engineering teams worldwide, first at Microsoft (10 years) and then at AWS (2 years). 

I'm an experienced public speaker, regularly participating in meetups and conferences.

sessions.name: 10 things you must know as a Backstage plugin contributor
Backstage Scaffolder: a quick win for some, the path to engineering excellence for many

bio: Tobias Schneck is a Principal Architect at Kubermatic, an open-source platform for Kubernetes management. He is a passionate advocate for open-source technologies and has a deep understanding of cloud-native infrastructure. Tobias has over 10 years of experience in the IT industry and has held various positions in development, operations, and architecture. He is a regular speaker at industry conferences and has written numerous blog posts and articles on cloud-native topics. Bringing the advantages of cloud native technologies and development workflows to everybody is his aim.

sessions.name: Kubernetes & AI - Beauty and the Beast!?!

bio:
Viktor Farcic is a Developer Advocate at Upbound, a member of the Google Developer Experts and Docker Captains groups, and a published author.

His big passions are DevOps, Containers, Kubernetes, Microservices, Continuous Integration, Delivery and Deployment (CI/CD) and Test-Driven Development (TDD).

He often speaks at community gatherings and conferences.

He published The DevOps Toolkit Series (https://www.devopstoolkitseries.com/), DevOps Paradox (https://amzn.to/2myrYYA) and Test-Driven Java Development (http://www.amazon.com/Test-Driven-Java-Development-Viktor-Farcic-ebook/dp/B00YSIM3SC), as well as courses in Udemy (https://www.udemy.com/user/viktor-farcic/).

His random thoughts and tutorials can be found in his blog TechnologyConversations.com.

He is the host of the DevOps Toolkit (https://youtube.com/c/devopstoolkit) YouTube channel and a co-host of DevOps Paradox (https://www.devopsparadox.com/) podcast.

sessions.name: Choose Your Own Adventure: The Struggle for Security
Serverless Computing on Kubernetes with Knative, Crossplane, Dapr, KEDA, Shipwright, and Friends

bio: Whitney is a lovable goofball and a CNCF Ambassador who enjoys understanding and using tools in the cloud native landscape. Creative and driven, Whitney recently pivoted from an art-related career to one in tech. You can catch her lightboard streaming show ⚡️ Enlightning on Tanzu.TV, and she also co-hosts the streaming show You Choose! - a 'Choose-Your-Own-Adventure'-style journey through the CNCF landscape alongside Viktor Farcic.
tagLine: CNCF Ambassador, Developer Advocate at Broadcom

sessions.name: Choose Your Own Adventure: The Struggle for Security

Additionally, I have hands-on experience in enhancing developer experience with Backstage. My goal is to design scalable, efficient, and automated infrastructure solutions, enabling continuous integration, delivery, and deployment.

sessions.name: Democratise Observability: Empowering the future with OpenTelemetry.

bio: Yujin is a software engineer at Consider IT GmbH, specializing in Kubernetes and infrastructure. With experience in V2X (Vehicle to Everything) technology, she has a keen interest in cloud-native solutions.
